about.title: About Me
about.bio2014: I started study Computer Science at PUC-GO in February 2014.
about.bio2017: Between August and December, during my 8th semester, I interned at IQUEGO (Industria Quimica do Estado de Goiás) in the IT support department, where I gained valuable experience working with networks and providing support to employees.
about.bio2018: I studied various subjects, completed my thesis, and finished my undergraduate degree in December 2018.
about.bio2019: The graduation ceremony took place in February 2019. Later that year, in December, I also started my own company specializing in manufacturing and selling denim clothing.
about.bio2022: In 2022, I decided to create a website to improve online sales. I returned to studying programming after a hiatus and created a website using WordPress. I found it better to create my own theme, so I used HTML5, CSS3, Bootstrap, and SASS. In August 2022, I started studying JavaScript, and in December, I began learning React.js.
about.bio2023: In 2023, I continued to enhance my knowledge and skills, particularly in JavaScript. I continued studying React and started working on several projects, including this portfolio, which was entirely created using React.js. I also started a second graduation in July of Analysis and Systems development at Descomplica.
about.educationItem2: Analysis and Systems development at Descomplica - Ongoing

portfolio.title: Portfolio Documentation
portfolio.titleText: This is a document that describes the main features of my portfolio project developed in React.
portfolio.aboutText: My portfolio project is a web application that showcases my experience, skills, and projects. It is a way to present my work and allow potential employers, clients, or collaborators to learn more about me and my projects.
portfolio.wasUsed: What was used to create this portfolio
portfolio.hooks: Usage of useState, useContext, and useEffect hooks

projects.title: My Projects
projects.project1Text: A personal project that is similar to the store that I created in WordPress in 2022, and now I decided to recreate in React, using Next.js and Tailwind and TypeScript.
projects.project2Text: A project created for managing expenses and displaying expense charts
